attributes.action: Repeal or modify EC Regulation 785/2004 in order to exempt historical aircraft such as Sally-B B17G from new minimum insurance requirements
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The EC Regulation 785/2004 (effective 01.05.2005) specifies a minimum insurance coverage for aircraft without making exemptions for historical aircraft such as Sally-B B17G, the only airworthy example of the famous "flying fortress" in the UK.

This puts such aircraft into the same category as a commercial Boeing 737. For aircraft maintained in the air solely on private donations, an extra cost of GBP 30,000.- per year is tantamount to grounding.

Unlike commercial aircraft, the historic aircraft is on a British Permit to Fly, and as such:

- is not allowed to carry out commercial flights
- is not allowed to fly for hire and reward
- is not allowed to carry passengers
- is not allowed to fly over populated areas

Despite this:

- it has its own maintenance company approved by the CAA
- its pilots are all ATPLs with extensive experience on tail wheel and heavy piston

AND it flies only 20-40 hours per year, between May and October.
